West on 42nd St.  1880

723704f-a.title: Manhattan: Vanderbilt Avenue - 42nd Street
723704f-a.text:
Vanderbilt Avenue, west side, from 42nd to 43rd Streets, showing
a corner of the Pershing Scuare Viaduct in the right foregi ound,
and a portion of the Hotel Biltmore on the N.W. corner of 43rd
Street. The building shon on 42nd Street, to the left of the
picture, is the newly erected Liggett-Ley Building on the N.E.
corner of Madison Avenue and 42nd Street.
Later views of Vanderbilt Avenue will show that eleven stories
have been added to the building which fills the center of this
picture.
About 1922.
ift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

712937f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712937f-a.text:
E. 42nd Street, at the N. E. corner of Vanderbilt Avenuo,
showing the (lst) Grand Central Depot of 1871. Tho photographer
is viewing duo northward from the line of Park Avenue.
About 1893
Cift of Urbrock Colloction
H. N. Tiemann, photo
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE

712934f-a.text:

Vanderbilt Avenue showing.

723710f-a.title: Manhattan: Vanderbilt Avenue - 42nd Street
723710f-a.text:
Vanderbilt Ave., south from, but not including East 47th., te and in.
cluding 42nd Streets. On the left appears the Grand Central Palace Build
with the Grand Central Station receding southward to 42nd Street, at which
point the Lincoln Building abruptly terminates the view. On the right,
shown the Roosevelt Hotel (46th to 45th Streets), the Vanderbilt Concourse
Building (S.W. corner of 45th Street) and the Hotel Biltmore (44th te 43rd
Streets), which is just south of the Yale Club (Building at the N.W. corner
of 44th Street, and bearing a dark banner).
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
CREDI LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

712950f-b.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712950f-b.text:
East 42nd Street, at the N.E. corner of Vanderbilt
Avenue, showing the southerly, or main side of the Grand
Central Station. Approaching same from Park Avenue at 40th
Street, is the ramp that carries traffic around this building
to emerge at 46th Street. The photographers vantage point is
the old Murray Hill Hotel. At the left foreground is the former
Belmont Hotel site. Vanderbilt avenue starts at that point.
Towering above the station is the Grand Central Building where
Fark Avenue reconm;ences.
August 25, 1931
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

712960f-c.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712960f-c.text:
60 to 72 East 42nd Street, south side, west of
Pershing Square (Park Avenue), showing the Lincoln
Building site under preparation. Here, formerly
stood the old seven story structure housing the
LLincoln National Bank and Safe Deposite Co. and the
five story Hotel Athens. Both of these extended
through the block to 41st Street and their demolition
has ooened a view of buildings on the south side of
that street. The dark structure to the left is the
old Murray Hill Hotel. Adjonig same are two low
buildings numbered 58 \& 56 E. 41st Street. The
Chemists Club is No. 50-54, the ten story dominant.
A four story affair, No. 46-48 separates this from
the twelve story office building, No. 40-44. The
latter adjofng the . E. corner structure at
Mndison Avenue.
View 1: August 22, 1928
'. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 2-6: Summer 1928
P. L. Sperr
MAY 3E RERODUCED

723703f-b.title: Manhattan: Vanderbilt Avenue - 42nd Street
723703f-b.text:
(1)
Vanderbilt Avenue, north from 42nd Street, showing the Pershing
Square Viaduct on the west side of the Grand Central Station,
and the new New York Central Building from 45th to 46th Streets,
hnearing completion.
This view is from the roof of the Chemists' Club on 41st Street,
and does not show the west side of Vanderbilt Avenue.
September 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPiODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, looking almost straight up Vanderbilt Avenue, and
showing less of the New York Central Building.
September 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A slightly later view, from the Murray Hill Hotel at Park
Avenue and 4st Street, showing the west side of Vanderbilt
Avenue. The Hotel Biltmore (opened January 1914) occupies the
block from 43rd to 44th Streets, and the Yale Club (built
about 1914) is on the N.W. corner of 44th Street.
October 22, 1928.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712953f-a.text:
East 42nd Street at the N.E. corner of Vanderbilt Ave. Grand Central
Terminal, at the northern end of lower Park Ave., from 42nd to 45th
Streets; the view at the left is north on the east side of Vanderbilt
Ave. The view is nearly the same as that of the old station taken about
1892, but closer and more restricted.
About 1929.
Ewing Galloway.
No REPRODUCTIONS.

712966f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712966f-a.text:
(1)
East 42nd Street, at the S.W. corner of Pershing Square, as seen
from Vanderbilt Ave., and showing the demolition of the Hotel Belmont.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same from another angle, and showing the west side of Pershing
Sduare (Park Ave), from East 42nd to 41st Streets.

NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)

Outdoor Cafe, as seen from under the raised behicular viaduct at this
point.
September 10, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712944f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712944f-a.text:
East 12nd Street at the N.E. corner of Vanderbilt Ave.
qrand Central Station, Park Avenue at 42nd Street, showing the ne
automobile viaduct, which in this view seems only Iecently com;
If that is true, then the new Interborough Subway lines have iu
been opened (notice passengers from the new qrand Central expIe
station coming up to the street in the foreground), the name
Pershing Square for this block has just been suggested by John
Bowman, and not yet officially adopted, General Pershing is sti
distinguishing himself in the War, and this is
Summer, 1918.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

1507915-a.title: 42nd Street (East) - Vanderbilt Avenue - Lexington Avenue, north side
1507915-a.folder: 42nd Street (East) - Vanderbilt Avenue - Lexington Avenue, north side, Manhattan, NY

712936f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712936f-a.text:
East 42nd Street at the N.E. corner of Vanderbilt Ave. Old Grand
Central Terminal, at the northern end of Park Ave., from 42nd to 45th
Streets. The view at the left is north on Vanderbilt Ave. At the
right may be seen the station of the 42nd Street elevated spur from
Third Ave. Immediately adjoining it on the north side of 42nd Street
is the archway through which trains, bound for Madison Square via
the Murray Hill-Park Ave. tunnel, used to emerage from the Grand Central.
When this station was built in 1871 the railroad began by leaving the
engine here and having the cars pulled down to Madison Square by horse;
some years before the date of this picture even that had ceased, and
this station became a terminal for all trains. At the N.E. corner of
Vanderbilt Ave. and 42nd Street, notice the florist's shop and the
barber's, also the two ladies carrying parasols.
About 1892.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

712959f-c.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue

Pershing Scuare (Park Ave.) showing the Lincoln Build-

northward the same to the 42nd Street frontage. TThis

that skirts the west side of Grand Central station, a
corner of which is at the rimht top. To the left is a
portion of the building at the N. W. corner. The side
wall of the later demolished Hotel Belmont is on the
right.
View 1: September 5, 1928

712959f-e.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712959f-e.text:
60 to 72 East 42nd Street, south side, west of
Pershing Scuare (Park Ave.) showing the Lincoln Build-
ing site being prenared. The photographer is viewing
northward the same to the 42nd Street frontage. TThis
is on a line with Vanderbilt Avenue, a thoroughfare
that skirts the west side of Grand Central station, a
corner of which is at the rimht top. To the left is a
portion of the building at the N. W. corner. The side
wall of the later demolished Hotel Belmont is on the
right.
View 1: September 5, 1928
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODCCTI.NS
Views 2-6: Summer 1928
MAY E REPRODUCED

1507913.title: 42nd Street (East) - Vanderbilt Avenue - Lexington Avenue
1507913.folder: 42nd Street (East) - Vanderbilt Avenue - Lexington Avenue, Manhattan, NY

712940f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712940f-a.text:
42nd Street, east from and including Vanuerbilt Avenue, showing old
Grand Central Terr;inal, also the Lincoln Safe Deposit Company
building at old No. 38 East 42nd Street, south side, with a
wing being added at No. 40. The building number will later be
changed to 60 East 42nd Street.
About 1895.
Elmendorf Fhoto,
from Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712952f-b.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712952f-b.text:
(1)
East 42nd Street, at the N.E. corner of Vcnderbilt Ave., as seen
from Park Ave. Shown across debris of the former Hotel Belmont, is the
Grand Central Station of the N.Y.C.R.h. Note the vehicular viaduct ex-
tending from Park Ave., and encircling the station. On the extreme rigut,
appears a portion of the Hotel Commodore. Across the skyline is seen
the tower of the Grand Central Building.
August 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view.
August 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A 1imited view, and showing prominently the ornamentation.
February 23, 1931.
P L. Sperr.
NO'REPRODUCTIONS.

Photo by American Press Assn.

712962f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
712962f-a.text:
42nd Street, west from and including Vanderbilt Avenue. The old
Lincoln Safe Deposit Company building at 60 East 42nd Street
(old No. 38) is about to be demolished.
Spring 1928.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
